posts.title: Ham in the Hamptons
posts.author: Humphrey Hamburg
posts.body: So, day 1. Went to a restaurant on the pier. Ordered me up some ham.

comment.author: Daisy McPheerson
comment.body: Was the ham any good? What is the name of the restaurant?

comment.author: Professor Nonsensical
comment.body: Did you have the bratwurst? Or did you encouter the worst brat to date?

posts.title: Captain Kosher
posts.author: Cody Victoria
posts.body: Your one stop shop for all things Kosher at a new store called 'Is there anything more'.

comment.author: Sammy Loftus
comment.body: How did you find this place?

posts.title: Holding for Pizza
posts.author: Ceasar Pretzel
posts.body: Who doesn't love a great showcase of historical pizza vignettes? Join us at the Center Market for a trip through history.

comment.author: Kalamata Tears
comment.body: This sounds so incredible! Who doesn't enjoy a pizza adventure? We'll be there!

posts.title: Peachy Keen
posts.author: Igloo Plaque
posts.body: O, to take what we love inside, to carry within us an orchard, to eat not only the skin, but the shade, not only the sugar, but the days, to hold the fruit in our hands, adore it, then bite into the round jubilance of peach. - Li-Young Lee

comment.author: Joyful Bean
comment.body: Jubilant is the rain drop that graces the vine, thankful is the peach that at once is bitten

comment.author: Transcendental Humperdink
comment.body: Life is but a state of love

posts.title: Time Tracer
posts.author: Chronos Importu
posts.body: The wistful eyes of times gone by bring nothing back to the Watchers. Left dormant, forever quiescent, dreaming of sapphire and silver, the gentle hearts of dragon kin break at mournful sound.

comment.author: Quicksilver Wizard
comment.body: Channeled once, twice, even a third time brought about naught but ruin for the Elaendar. Helps to know where to look!

posts.title: Exact Minutia
posts.author: Jimmy The Hand
posts.body: Knowing not only where, but when, who, and how to snatch a coin is as exacting as Science yet requires an artful elegance

comment.author: Secondchance Charile
comment.body: How many times guaranteed before a lost hand is fated?

comment.author: Member Absentia
comment.body: I feel I had a good run, take note that I can only feel with one hand.

posts.title: Scribbling Scribes
posts.author: Jay Son
posts.body: The funcitonal abilty of a document store database is iteratively approaching the threshold of serving the needs of relational database users.

comment.author: Skeptical Flux
comment.body: To make such a claim borders on either naivety or perhaps strides have been made in the non-relational database world

posts.title: The First and Last Decision I have Regretted
posts.author: Everything-Is-Awesome Jones
posts.body: I made a decision many years back to harbor self-doubt. This while at one level was a concsious choice, on many other levels it was reinforced by my perception of circumstance and delusion. Regaining my ability to choose, to be proactive, to even be active has re-defined who I am to myself. My perception has undergone a revitalization and lingers on myself much less.

posts.title: Soothsayer Cipher
posts.author: Fetter Ol'Heim
posts.body: Speak Truth to Power. This maxim has provided many individuals the hope perceived injustice can be corrected through translation of objective truth.

comment.author: Dream City
comment.body: Often the powers lack ears as they have removed them.

posts.title: The Garden
posts.author: Summer Huxley
posts.body: Summer is in full swing in our garden. The earth has bloomed. We are enjoying the listful days bright with growth and to fall into breezy evenings.

comment.author: GreenThumb98
comment.body: I love subsisting from our garden. Let us know what vegetables you have so far!

comment.author: Cherished Greens
comment.body: The sentimental nature of gardening is one of the most enjoyable aspects of tearing up the earth each spring, that and the relaxation of working with the earth.
